column4: if you right click the system clock you can go to preferences
i have multiple locations set for time, i want to switch one, since i am currently outside my home country
mm let me check hold on
there's no prioritize button, or "set as default" button :(
oh you want set to defaults  ok mmm  hold on
so you want to change the time to where you are located at the moment?
no i have two locations listed, each have their own time. however, only one of them shows on my panel, i want to switch: instead of location A's time showing, I want to see location B's time
mm I am       stumped on this one
i think the functionality doesn't exist 6__6, but i wouldn't be surprised if the value is stored somewhere in gconf...
mm you may be correct ...let me look in gconf hold on
yeah i'm looking, played around with that entry, changed from "false" to "true" and vice versa, but it didnt work xD
do you think it'll work if i restart x? usually gnome settings are instantaneous...
that was going to be my next suggestion  at least for testing those settings
mm yeah, ill finish what i'm doing and restart x... i'll let you know how that goes xD
